answer:
QUESTION

1}i am a taxi driver and my customers most of them are engaged in hotel bussines and other related jobs will the money i earn be haram?

2}i comitted zina many times knowing the fact that its one of the mager sin i used to involve in islamic activity and even people considerd me to be the most pios among them and know my heart is so hurt about it and i can stand my eyes from crying whenever i remember my evil deed ......will allah forgive a person like me.....and am planing to change the country for this matter what do you advice me jezakumullah

 

ANSWER


Share:

 

In the name of Allāh, Most Gracious, Most Merciful


Assalāmu ῾alaykum wa Rahmatullāhi Wabarakātuh

 

1. If you are not sure about the income of your customers as to whether it is permissible or not, your earning will be Halāl. However, to understand what exactly constitutes as assisting in sin and thereby causing one’s earning to be impermissible please read Fatwa #17597 on our website www.askimam.org 

2. Allah is Most Gracious and Most Merciful. He says in the Noble Qur'aan,

“Oh My Slaves!  Do not despair in the mercy of Allāh Ta῾āla. Verily Allah forgives all sins”[1]

(Surah Zūmar, Ayyah 53)

In a hadīth narrated by Anas bin Mālik radiyallāhu ῾anhu, Rasulullāh Sallallāhu ῾alaihi Wasallam said, “Allāh is more happy with the repentance of his slave than one of you (would be happy) if he suddenly stumbled upon (i.e. found) his camel after having lost it in a desert (and given up any hope).”[2] (Bukhāri sharīf, Vol.7-8, Pg.189, Dārulfikr)

Therefore, you should   make firm intention to reform and never repeat the sin, then surely Allāh Ta῾āla is Tawwāb (Most Forgiving). Finally, we suggest that you remain at your residing country.

And Allāh Ta῾āla Knows Best
Wassalāmu ῾alaykum

 

Ml. Abduz Zaman,
Student Dārul Iftā

Checked and Approved by:
Mufti Ebrahim Desai
Dārul Iftā




1 قُلْ يَا عِبَادِيَ الَّذِينَ أَسْرَفُوا عَلَى أَنْفُسِهِمْ لَا تَقْنَطُوا مِنْ رَحْمَةِ اللَّهِ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ جَمِيعًا إِنَّهُ هُوَ الْغَفُورُ الرَّحِيمُ (سورةالزمر،آية:53)
